body:
**Context:**

The `BitcoinTestFramework` test parameters are set in `set_test_params()`, but there are additional test [run-time settings](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/test/functional/test_framework/test_framework.py#L134) which can be passed in through the command-line. The latter are documented with the command-line help strings. Note that there are command-line arguments which differ in naming compared to the class member where they are set:

	- `--tracerpc` vs `BitcoinTestFramework.options.trace_rpc`
	- `--portseed` vs `BitcoinTestFramework.options.port_seed`

The `TestShell` is a `BitcoinTestFramework` child class, and allows all test parameters to be passed in `setup(**test_args)`. The keys for `test_args` are identical to the respective parent class members to simplify argument forwarding.

	- `TestShell.setup(trace_rpc= â¦)` vs. `BitcoinTestFramework.options.trace_rpc`
	- `TestShell.setup(port_seed= â¦)` vs. `BitcoinTestFramework.options.port_seed`

However, by extension, `test_args` are now inconsistent with the command-line args of its parent class.

**Issue:**

The TestShell [documentation](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/test/functional/test_framework/test_framework.py#L134) currently covers TestShell-specific argument keys, which donât entirely translate to the BitcoinTestFramework documentation as mentioned above. It would be nice to find a way to neatly consolidate both in one place.
title: Doc: Consolidate documentation of functional test parameters.
